definition: to imprison/to jail/to take into custody

sentences.english: Peddling a handful can lead to a 15-year sentence.
sentences.chinese: 兜售一把藥可能引來15年監禁。

sentences.english: Correia has watched her brother spend half his life in prison.
sentences.chinese: 科雷亞已經看了她的哥哥花一半他終身監禁。

sentences.english: A bean in liberty is better than a comfit in prison.
sentences.chinese: 閒散的豆子總比監禁的糖果要強。

sentences.english: All three crimes carry a maximum 10-year prison penalty.
sentences.chinese: 三種罪狀每種最高可判10年監禁。

sentences.english: Their incarceration adds costs far greater than the alleged savings in the court system.
sentences.chinese: 監禁他們的費用遠比法院系統節約的費用要高得多。

sentences.english: The king is captivated by your tresses .
sentences.chinese: 王被這下垂的發綹監禁了。

sentences.english: Newsweek’s Maziar Bahari still languishes incommunicado in prison more than two months after his arrest.
sentences.chinese: 自從他被捕之後，他已經被單獨監禁兩個多月了。

sentences.english: If both confess, they will each be jailed 15 years.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們同時認罪，他們就要被監禁15年。

sentences.english: The representation of the non-confinement penalty policy to the guarantees of human rights to criminals is indirect.
sentences.chinese: 非監禁刑政策對罪犯人權保障的體現是間接的。

sentences.english: If convicted, Benaissa faces between six months and 10 years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 如被判有罪，貝奈薩將面臨6個月到10年的監禁。

sentences.english: If convicted, he faces up to 121 years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 如果指控成立，他將面臨着121年的監禁。

sentences.english: He faces life in prison if convicted.
sentences.chinese: 如果指控成立，他將面臨終身監禁。

sentences.english: But in 1986, he was sentenced to three consecutive life terms.
sentences.chinese: 但在1986年，他被判處終身監禁三連冠。

sentences.english: He resigned from that position on the day Goodman was jailed.
sentences.chinese: 在古德曼被判監禁的同一天，他就辭職了。

sentences.english: Rajaratnam, 53, now faces 20 years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 現年53歲的拉賈拉特南將面臨20年監禁。

definition: to go to jail/to be sent to prison
judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
